description: Within [[Colombia]], the term '''Música popular''' ({{IPA|es|ˈmusika popuˈlaɾ}}, 'popular music') is often used to refer to a [[folk music]] genre originated between the 1930s and 1940s in the [[Paisa Region]], in the northwestern part of the country, influenced primarily by Mexican folk music, as well as Argentinian, Ecuadorian and Peruvian to a lesser degree. Eventually it lost these combinations and currently is a mixture of different genres of [[Regional Mexican]].{{citation needed|date=December 2023}}
